title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1.28 - Executive order no. 28: designating the social development planning commission as the state's official long-range social development planning agency
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 § 1.28 - Executive order no. 28: designating the social development planning commission as the state's official long-range social development planning agency

State Regulations
I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Governor of the State of New

York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of
the State of New York, do hereby establish in the Executive Department an
interdepartmental social development planning commission, to be known as the

Social Development Planning Commission, to consist of the Commissioner of

Social Services as chairman, the Director of the Office of Economic Opportunity
as vice-chairman, and the Commissioners of Education, Health, Human Rights, Labor, Mental Hygiene, Local Government, Housing and Community Renewal, the

Chancellor of the State University, the Director of the Division for Youth, and
the Director of the Office for the Aging. The Directors of the Office of

Planning Coordination and the Division of the Budget shall serve as non-voting
members. I. General Powers. The Commission shall coordinate and review social
development planning efforts among governmental and non-governmental agencies, organizations and groups concerned with services, facilities and manpower and
shall formulate and update on a continuous basis a comprehensive State social
development plan. "Social development planning" shall include planning for
assistance to the disadvantaged, increased job opportunity, human right, employee protection, and coordination of administration. The Commission's
social development plan shall be reviewed annually by the Office of Planning

Coordination and shall be coordinated with the State comprehensive development
plan and the comprehensive planning process being developed by the Office of

Planning Coordination. The Commission shall review all the plans of State agencies
relating to the provision of social services to assure that such plans are in
accordance with the comprehensive State social development plan. In exercising its powers, functions and duties, the

Commission shall be responsible to the Governor and shall consult and work
closely with the Social Development Planning Advisory Council. II. Social Development Advisory

Council. A Social Development Planning Advisory Council is hereby
established to consist of representatives of governmental and non-governmental
organizations and groups to advise the Social Development Planning Commission
in the exercise of its powers, functions and duties under this Order. The
members of the Advisory Council shall be appointed by the Governor. III. Personnel. The Commission shall appoint an executive director and
shall assign to such director such powers, functions and duties as it shall
deem appropriate to fulfill the purposes of this order. The Commission may also
employ such other personnel as it may deem necessary or desirable to fulfill
the purposes of this order. Signed: Nelson A. RockefellerDated: September 16, 1968
[FN*] [Amended by Executive Order No. 48 (Nelson A. Rockefeller), §
1.48, infra).]
